prompt: What words are used for remembering Allah (dhikr: SubhānAllāh, Alhamdulillāh, Allāhu Akbar)?
response:
Arabic: سبحان الله، الحمد لله، الله أكبر.

Transliteration: SubḥānAllāh, al-ḥamdu lillāh, Allāhu akbar.

English: Glory be to Allah, praise be to Allah, Allah is the Greatest.

prompt: List the three surahs to recite in the evening.
response:
Arabic: قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ، قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَقِ، قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ.

Transliteration: Qul huwa Allāhu aḥad, Qul aʿūdhu birabbil-falaq, Qul aʿūdhu birabbin-nās.

English: Surah al-Ikhlās, Surah al-Falaq, and Surah an-Nās.

prompt: What dua is said when leaving the house?
response:
Arabic: بسم الله، توكلت على الله، ولا حول ولا قوة إلا بالله.

Transliteration: Bismillāh, tawakkaltu ʿalallāh, wa lā ḥawla wa lā quwwata illā billāh.

English: In the name of Allah, I place my trust in Allah, and there is no power nor might except with Allah.

prompt: What dua is said when entering the house?
response:
Arabic: بسم الله ولجنا، وبسم الله خرجنا، وعلى الله ربنا توكلنا.

Transliteration: Bismillāhi walajnā, wa bismillāhi kharajnā, wa ʿalallāhi rabbanā tawakkalnā.

English: In the name of Allah we enter, in the name of Allah we leave, and upon our Lord we rely.

prompt: What is the dua before eating?
response:
Arabic: بسم الله.

Transliteration: Bismillāh.

English: In the name of Allah.

prompt: What is the dua after finishing a meal?
response:
Arabic: الحمد لله الذي أطعمنا وسقانا وجعلنا مسلمين.

Transliteration: Al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aṭʿamanā wa saqānā wa jaʿalanā muslimīn.

English: Praise be to Allah who fed us, gave us drink, and made us Muslims.

prompt: What dua is said when boarding a vehicle?
response:
Arabic: سبحان الذي سخر لنا هذا وما كنا له مقرنين، وإنا إلى ربنا لمنقلبون.

Transliteration: Subḥānalladhī sakhkhara lanā hādhā wa mā kunnā lahu muqrinīn, wa innā ilā rabbinā lamunqalibūn.

English: Glory be to Him who has subjected this to us, and we could not have done it ourselves. Surely, to our Lord we will return.

prompt: What dua is said upon entering the restroom?
response:
Arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إنِّي أعوذ بك من الخبث والخبائث.

Transliteration: Allāhumma innī aʿūdhu bika minal-khubthi wal-khabāʾith.

English: O Allah, I seek refuge with You from male and female devils.

prompt: What dua is said after leaving the restroom?
response:
Arabic: غفرانك.

Transliteration: Ghufrānak.

English: I ask You for forgiveness.

prompt: What dua is said upon hearing the Adhān (call to prayer)?
response:
Arabic: اللَّهُمَّ رب هذه الدعوة التامة والصلاة القائمة، آت محمداً الوسيلة والفضيلة، وابعثه مقاماً محموداً الذي وعدته...

Transliteration: Allāhumma rabba hādhihi-d-daʿwati-t-tāmmah waṣ-ṣalāti-l-qāʾimah, ātī Muḥammadan al-wasīlata wal-faḍīlah, wabʿath-hu maqāman maḥmūdan alladhī waʿadtah...

English: O Allah, Lord of this perfect call and the established prayer, grant Muhammad the means and the virtue, and raise him to a praised station which You have promised...

prompt: What is the dua when waking up from sleep?
response:
Arabic: الحمد لله الذي أحيانا بعدما أماتنا وإليه النشور.

Transliteration: Al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aḥyānā baʿda mā amātanā wa ilayhin-nushūr.

English: Praise be to Allah who gave us life after causing us to die, and to Him is the resurrection.

prompt: What is the dua before sleeping?
response:
Arabic: باسمك اللهم أموت وأحيا.

Transliteration: Bismika Allāhumma amūtu wa aḥyā.

English: In Your name, O Allah, I die and I live.

prompt: What dua is said when putting on new clothes?
response:
Arabic: الحمد لله الذي كساني هذا الثوب ورزقنيه من غير حول مني ولا قوة.

Transliteration: Al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī kasānī hādhā-th-thawb wa razaqanīhi min ghayri ḥawlin minnī wa lā quwwah.

English: Praise be to Allah who clothed me with this garment and provided it to me without power or might from myself.

prompt: What dua is said when looking in the mirror?
response:
Arabic: اللهم كما حسنت خَلقي فحسن خُلقي.

Transliteration: Allāhumma kamā ḥassanta khalqī faḥassin khuluqī.

English: O Allah, just as You have beautified my appearance, beautify my character.

prompt: What dua is said when visiting the sick?
response:
Arabic: لا بأس طهور إن شاء الله.

Transliteration: Lā baʾs, ṭahūr in shāʾ Allāh.

English: No harm, it is a purification if Allah wills.

prompt: What dua is said when sneezing?
response:
Arabic: الحمد لله.

Transliteration: Al-ḥamdu lillāh.

English: Praise be to Allah.

prompt: What dua is said when hearing someone sneeze?
response:
Arabic: يرحمك الله.

Transliteration: YarḥamukAllāh.

English: May Allah have mercy on you.

prompt: What dua is said when thanking someone?
response:
Arabic: جزاك الله خيرًا.

Transliteration: JazākAllāhu khayran.

English: May Allah reward you with goodness.

prompt: What dua is said after drinking milk?
response:
Arabic: اللهم بارك لنا فيه وزدنا منه.

Transliteration: Allāhumma bārik lanā fīhi wa zidnā minhu.

English: O Allah, bless it for us and increase us in it.

prompt: What dua is said after drinking water?
response:
Arabic: الحمد لله الذي سقانا عذبًا فراتًا برحمته، ولم يجعله ملحًا أجاجًا بذنوبنا.

Transliteration: Al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī saqānā ʿadhban furātan biraḥmatih, wa lam yajʿalhu milḥan ujājān bidhunūbinā.

English: Praise be to Allah who gave us sweet fresh water by His mercy and did not make it bitter and salty due to our sins.

prompt: What dua is said when entering the mosque?
response:
Arabic: اللهم افتح لي أبواب رحمتك.

Transliteration: Allāhumma iftaḥ lī abwāba raḥmatik.

English: O Allah, open for me the doors of Your mercy.

prompt: What dua is said when leaving the mosque?
response:
Arabic: اللهم إني أسألك من فضلك.

Transliteration: Allāhumma innī asʾaluka min faḍlik.

English: O Allah, I ask You from Your bounty.

prompt: What dua is said when beginning ablution (wudūʾ)?
response:
Arabic: بسم الله.

Transliteration: Bismillāh.

English: In the name of Allah.

prompt: What dua is said after completing ablution?
response:
Arabic: أشهد أن لا إله إلا الله وحده لا شريك له، وأشهد أن محمدًا عبده ورسوله. اللهم اجعلني من التوابين واجعلني من المتطهرين.

Transliteration: Ashhadu an lā ilāha illallāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah, wa ashhadu anna Muḥammadan ʿabduhu wa rasūluh. Allāhummajʿalnī minat-tawwābīn, wajʿalnī minal-mutaṭahhirīn.

English: I bear witness that none has the right to be worshiped but Allah alone without partner, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and Messenger. O Allah, make me among those who repent and purify themselves.

prompt: What dua is said when it rains?
response:
Arabic: اللهم صيبًا نافعًا.

Transliteration: Allāhumma ṣayyiban nāfiʿan.

English: O Allah, make it a beneficial rain.

prompt: What dua is said after rain has stopped?
response:
Arabic: مُطِرنا بفضل الله ورحمته.

Transliteration: Muṭirnā bi-faḍlillāhi wa raḥmatih.

English: We have been given rain by the grace and mercy of Allah.

prompt: What dua is said during a thunderstorm?
response:
Arabic: سبحان الذي يسبح الرعد بحمده والملائكة من خيفته.

Transliteration: Subḥānalladhī yusabbiḥur-raʿdu bi-ḥamdih, wal-malāʾikatu min khīfatih.

English: Glory be to Him whom the thunder and the angels praise out of fear of Him.

prompt: What dua is said when wearing shoes?
response:
Arabic: بسم الله.

Transliteration: Bismillāh.

English: In the name of Allah.

prompt: What dua is said when anger overtakes a person?
response:
Arabic: أعوذ بالله من الشيطان الرجيم.

Transliteration: Aʿūdhu billāhi minash-shayṭānir-rajīm.

English: I seek refuge with Allah from the accursed devil.

prompt: What dua is said upon seeing something you like?
response:
Arabic: ما شاء الله لا قوة إلا بالله.

Transliteration: Mā shāʾAllāhu lā quwwata illā billāh.

English: What Allah has willed has happened; there is no power except with Allah.

prompt: What dua is said when visiting the graveyard?
response:
Arabic: السلام عليكم دار قوم مؤمنين، وإنا إن شاء الله بكم لاحقون، يرحم الله المستقدمين منا والمستأخرين.

Transliteration: As-salāmu ʿalaykum dāra qawmin muʾminīn, wa innā in shāʾAllāhu bikum lāḥiqūn, yarḥamullāhul-mustaqdimīna minnā wal-mustaʾkhirīn.

English: Peace be upon you, O people of the believing dwellings. Indeed, we will, if Allah wills, join you. May Allah have mercy on those who went ahead of us and those who will follow.

prompt: What dua is said when a calamity strikes?
response:
Arabic: إنا لله وإنا إليه راجعون، اللهم أجرني في مصيبتي واخلف لي خيرًا منها.

Transliteration: Innā lillāhi wa innā ilayhi rājiʿūn. Allāhumma ajirnī fī muṣībatī wakhluf lī khayran minhā.

English: Surely, to Allah we belong and to Him we return. O Allah, reward me for my affliction and replace it for me with something better.

prompt: What dua is said when seeing someone afflicted by misfortune?
response:
Arabic: الحمد لله الذي عافاني مما ابتلاك به، وفضلني على كثير ممن خلق تفضيلاً.

Transliteration: Al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ʿāfānī mimmā ibtalāka bih, wa faḍḍalanī ʿalā kathīrin mimman khalaqa tafḍīlā.

English: Praise be to Allah who spared me from what He tested you with and preferred me greatly over many of His creation.

prompt: What dua is said when beginning a journey?
response:
Arabic: اللهم إنا نسألك في سفرنا هذا البر والتقوى، ومن العمل ما ترضى...

Transliteration: Allāhumma innā nasʾaluka fī safarinā hādhā al-birra wat-taqwā, wa mina-l-ʿamali mā tarḍā...

English: O Allah, we ask You on this journey for righteousness and piety, and for deeds that please You...

prompt: What dua is said when returning from a journey?
response:
Arabic: آيبون، تائبون، عابدون، لربنا حامدون.

Transliteration: Āʾibūn, tāʾibūn, ʿābidūn, li-rabbinā ḥāmidūn.

English: Returning, repenting, worshiping, praising our Lord.

prompt: What dua is said when starting a meal with others?
response:
Arabic: اللهم بارك لنا فيما رزقتنا، واغفر لنا، وارحمنا.

Transliteration: Allāhumma bārik lanā fīmā razaqtanā, waghfir lanā, warḥamnā.

English: O Allah, bless us in what You have provided, forgive us, and have mercy on us.

prompt: What dua is said when finishing a gathering?
response:
Arabic: سبحانك اللهم وبحمدك، أشهد أن لا إله إلا أنت، أستغفرك وأتوب إليك.

Transliteration: Subḥānaka Allāhumma wa biḥamdik, ashhadu an lā ilāha illā anta, astaghfiruka wa atūbu ilayk.

English: Glory is to You, O Allah, and praise. I bear witness there is none worthy of worship but You. I seek Your forgiveness and turn to You in repentance.

prompt: What dua is said for someone who gives you a loan?
response:
Arabic: بارك الله لك في أهلك ومالك، جزاك الله خيرًا.

Transliteration: BārakAllāhu laka fī ahlika wa mālik, jazākAllāhu khayran.

English: May Allah bless you in your family and wealth. May Allah reward you with goodness.

prompt: What dua is said for someone who sneezes and praises Allah?
response:
Arabic: يَهْدِيكُمُ اللَّهُ وَيُصْلِحُ بَالَكُمْ.

Transliteration: Yahdīkumullāhu wa yuṣliḥu bālakum.

English: May Allah guide you and set your affairs right.

prompt: What dua is said when breaking the fast?
response:
Arabic: ذهب الظمأ وابتلت العروق وثبت الأجر إن شاء الله.

Transliteration: Dhahaba-ẓ-ẓamaʾ wa-btallati-l-ʿurūq wa-thabata-l-ajru in shāʾ Allāh.

English: The thirst has gone, the veins are moistened, and the reward is confirmed, if Allah wills.
